category: be-brave, brave-honeys, bravery, courage, dog-daze, fearless, honey-moon, uniqueness, young-lady

quote: And indeed, if we had only the courage to listen to the simplest, the nearest, most pressing voice of our conscience, and be deaf to all else, it were doubtless our solitary duty to relieve the suffering about us to the greatest extent in our power.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck, Wisdom And Destiny

quote: It is well to believe that there needs but a little more thought, a little more courage, more love, more devotion to life, a little more eagerness, one day to fling open wide the portals of joy and of truth.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck, Wisdom And Destiny

quote: CourageIt is in the small things we see it.The child's first step,as awesome as an earthquake.The first time you rode a bike,wallowing up the sidewalk.The first spanking when your heartwent on a journey all alone.When they called you crybabyor poor or fatty or crazyand made you into an alien,you drank their acidand concealed it.Later,if you faced the death of bombs and bulletsyou did not do it with a banner,you did it with only a hat tocover your heart.You did not fondle the weakness inside youthough it was there.Your courage was a small coalthat you kept swallowing.If your buddy saved youand died himself in so doing,then his courage was not courage,it was love; love as simple as shaving soap.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: No one would speak, so Terence took a deep breath, let it out slowly, and said, "My liege?""Yes, Terence?""Twenty years ago I decided I would die for you. I may not be able to do that tomorrow, but if I can't, I can at least die beside you.
author: Gerald Morris, The Legend of the King

quote: Bravery comes along as a gradual accumulation of discipline
author: Buzz Aldrin

quote: It will be very hard. You’ll make a million mistakes, and you’ll pay for them all, one way or another. But the hard parts will be your parts, they won’t be hard parts other people have imposed on you for their own reasons, or maybe for no reason at all. And your ownership of them – your responsibility to and for them – makes all the difference in the world.
author: Derrick Jensen, Walking on Water: Reading, Writing, and Revolution
category: challenge-and-attitude, courage, experiences, inspirational, life, mistakes, ownership, risk

quote: Sacrifice isn't supposed to be easy ... but it should come that way.
author: Robert Vanleeuwen
category: courage, honor, life, love, sacrifice, truth

quote: His insights have come to him through a crack in the veneer of civilization, which was also a crack in his own soul. He had the courage to look in this direction.
author: Susan Griffin, A Chorus of Stones: The Private Life of War

quote: You don’t know what your account balance of personal courage is until that situation presents itself where that check needs to be written and cashed
author: Donavan Nelson Butler

quote: These days, a sling of truth, still can make Goliath fall.
author: Tom Althouse, The Frowny Face Cow

quote: A good author is he who isn’t afraid to speak his mind; he who dictates the art of the verse. A scribbler who merely keeps quiet and enjoys being lauded is nothing but a reader with nothing of importance to do. He whose written word trickles from his wounds into the world and onto paper is not afraid to both praise and criticize, this is what he strives towards.
author: Leila Samarrai

quote: The strangest of our powersIs the courage to liveKnowing that we will die,Knowing nothing more
author: Nâzım Hikmet, Poems of Nazım Hikmet

quote: Sometimes the thing you think will fix everything ruins it instead. And sometimes what hurts you has to tear you apart before it makes you stronger.
author: C.J. Redwine, Deliverance

quote: Thank you for telling me fairy tales, but also for teaching me how to face the battle I'd need to win in real life.
author: C.J. Redwine, Deliverance

quote: The greatest act of courage is to be and to own all of who you are — without apology, without excuses, without masks to cover the truth of who you are.
author: Debbie Ford, Courage: Overcoming Fear and Igniting Self-Confidence

quote: Whatever strength, courage... madness keeps us going, we find it, in times like these. You have it, soldier. It's what kept you alive all this time.
author: Danny Strong, The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1 screenplay
category: courage, hunger-games, inner-strength, madness, mental-health, mockingjay, mockingjay-hunger-games, resilience, strength

quote: True courage comes not just from feeling confident and strong, but from being the honest, authentic expression of yourself. Think about how audacious it is to really believe in yourself. It tathat your presence on this earth matters.
author: Debbie Ford, Courage: Overcoming Fear and Igniting Self-Confidence
category: authentic-self, authenticity, bravery, courage, inner-strength, overcoming-fear, self-value

quote: No matter how deep the night is, there will always be a daylight. MAWUKO
author: WISDOM KWASHIE MENSAH (WKM)
category: courage, daylight, deep, greatness, hqm, hqm-quotes, mawuko, only-god, rymm, rymmpetit-quotes, sureness, whrm-quotes, wkm, wkm-quotes

quote: You have been chosen, and you must therefore use such strength and heart and wits as you have.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Without craziness, there is no courage.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: ...[Y]ou know very well the truth of what I [say]... I have incurred a great deal of bitter hostility; and this is what will bring about my destruction, if anything does... the slander and jealousy of a very large section of the people. They have been fatal to a great many other innocent men, and I suppose will continue to be so; there is no likelihood that they will stop at me. But perhaps someone will say 'Do you feel no compunction, Socrates, at having followed a line of action which puts you in danger of the death-penalty?' I might fairly reply to him 'You are mistaken, my friend, if you think that a man who is worth anything ought to spend his time weighing up the prospects of life and death. He has only one thing to consider in performing any action; that is, whether he is acting rightly or wrongly, like a good man or a bad one...['] The truth of the matter is this, gentlemen. Where a man has once taken up his stand, either because it seems best to him or in obedience to his orders, there I believe he is bound to remain and face the danger, taking no account of death or anything else before dishonour.
author: Socrates, Apology, Crito and Phaedo of Socrates.

quote: Suppose... that you acquit me... Suppose that, in view of this, you said to me 'Socrates, on this occasion we shall disregard Anytus and acquit you, but only on one condition, that you give up spending your time on this quest and stop philosophizing. If we catch you going on in the same way, you shall be put to death.' Well, supposing, as I said, that you should offer to acquit me on these terms, I should reply 'Gentlemen, I am your very grateful and devoted servant, but I owe a greater obedience to God than to you; and so long as I draw breath and have my faculties, I shall never stop practicing philosophy and exhorting you and elucidating the truth for everyone that I meet. I shall go on saying, in my usual way, "My very good friend, you are an Athenian and belong to a city which is the greatest and most famous in the world for its wisdom and strength. Are you not ashamed that you give your attention to acquiring as much money as possible, and similarly with reputation and honour, and give no attention or thought to truth and understanding and the perfection of your soul?" And if any of you disputes this and professes to care about these things, I shall not at once let him go or leave him; no, I shall question him and examine him and test him; and if it appears that in spite of his profession he has made no real progress towards goodness, I shall reprove him for neglecting what is of supreme importance, and giving his attention to trivialities. I shall do this to everyone that I meet, young or old, foreigner or fellow-citizen; but especially to you my fellow-citizens, inasmuch as you are closer to me in kinship. This, I do assure you, is what my God commands; and it is my belief that no greater good has ever befallen you in this city than my service to my God; for I spend all my time going about trying to persuade you, young and old, to make your first and chief concern not for your bodies nor for your possessions, but for the highest welfare of your souls, proclaiming as I go 'Wealth does not bring goodness, but goodness brings wealth and every other blessing, both to the individual and to the State.' ...And so, gentlemen, I would say, 'You can please yourselves whether you listen to Anytus or not, and whether you acquit me or not; you know that I am not going to alter my conduct, not even if I have to die a hundred deaths.
author: Socrates, Apology, Crito and Phaedo of Socrates.

quote: ...[S]ome of the opinions which people entertain should be respected, and others should not.
author: Socrates, Apology, Crito and Phaedo of Socrates.

quote: You need energy and purpose to become the person you’re destined to be.
author: Fennel Hudson, Traditional Angling - Fennel's Journal - No. 6

quote: Stand up for your beliefs, and be different.
author: Fennel Hudson, Traditional Angling - Fennel's Journal - No. 6

quote: Appear On Your Fear, It Will Disappear
author: Syed Sharukh
category: courage, courage-quotes, courage-to-be-oneself, courageous-mindsets, fear-quote, fearless, fearless-quotes, fearlessness

quote: All good things are borne from evil, just like good people. It’s very rare that someone does things purely out of the goodness of their heart. Most need something to fight against, something to drive them forward in order to create a light in what will always be a very dark world.
author: Kevin Reaver, Plague of Sorrow

quote: What--has O-Tar seen an ulsio and fainted?" demanded I-Gos with broad sarcasm."Men have died for less than that, ancient one," E-Thas reminded him."I am safe," retorted I-Gos, "for I am not a brave and popular son of the jeddak of Manator.
author: Edgar Rice Burroughs, The Chessmen of Mars
category: age, courage, cowardice, retort, sarcasm, threat

quote: I don’t want you to be a people-pleaser
author: you need to stand up for what you want and what you believe.
category: Amy Reece, You & Me Forever: a Sweet Romance Collection

quote: You're only a victim to the degree of what your perception allows.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: courage, endurance, fortitude, god-s-plan, perception, reality, strength, victim, victim-mentality

quote: The most powerful and courageous heroes I know are those who bite their tongues when justification, validation, temptation, or vengeance would have them strike with truthful, hurtful words.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: bite-your-tongue, courage, hero, heroes, hurtful-words, justification, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-control, temptation, validation, vengeance

quote: Let your conscience be your scripture and your actions be your religion. Let the humans be your church and compassion be your worship. Let love be your gospel and acceptance be your revelation.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Illusion of Religion: A Treatise on Religious Fundamentalism
category: acceptance, brainy-quotes, church, compassion, conscience, courage, gospel, humanism, inspirational, inspiring, love, love-and-kindness, philosophy-of-religion, religion, religion-and-philosophy, revelation, sage-quotes, self-awareness, service-of-humanity, worship

quote: Courage doesn’t defeat fear or erase fear or adjust to fear. Courage acts, plain and simple, in the midst of fear.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-brave, be-courageous, brave, bravery, courage, courage-quotes, courageous, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Mad fearlessness is not courage. The only requirement for courage is a good heart.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-brave, brave, bravery, courage, courage-quotes, courageous, good-heart, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The Kingdom of God is, in reality, the mental kingdom of a conscientious, compassionate and courageous human.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Illusion of Religion: A Treatise on Religious Fundamentalism
category: brainy-quotes, compassion, conscience, courage, humanism, inspiring, kingdom-of-god, kingdom-of-heaven, philosophy, philosophy-of-religion, truth

quote: Chance favours the bold.
author: Jessica Shirvington, Disruption

quote: In life, courage is sometimes to enter through the door and sometimes it is to walk out the door!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: courage, courage-in-life, courage-quotes, courageous, door, door-quotations, door-quotes, doors, entering-door, ildan-wisdom, ildan-wise-sayings, ildan-words, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotations, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotes, turkish-aphorisms, turkish-authors, turkish-literature, turkish-playwrights, turkish-quotations, turkish-quotes, turkish-sayings, turkish-thinkers, turkish-wisdom-words, turkish-writers

quote: Found myself kneeling in Your presenceSeeking Your wisdom and embraceLetting go all the fears and found peaceYou put joy in my heart that my soul endlessly rejoices
author: Angelica David

quote: Compromise is a choice. As is the defence of one’s self.
author: Fennel Hudson, Fine Things - Fennel's Journal - No. 8
category: choice, compromise, conviction, courage, identity, self

quote: Courage isn’t being a dragon. Neither is it behaving like a dragon. Nor is it taking up arms to fight and defeat dragons. Courage is being a lamb standing with poise among dragons.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: being-courageous, brave, bravery, courage, courageous, dragons, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The American soldiers were brave, but courage is not enough. David did not kill Goliath just because he was brave. He looked up at Goliath and realized that if he fought Goliath’s way with a sword, Goliath would kill him. But if he picked up a rock and put it in his sling, he could hit Goliath in the head and knock Goliath down and kill him. David used his mind when he fought Goliath. So did we Vietnamese when we had to fight the Americans.
author: Vo Nguyen Giap
category: courage, david, goliath, guerilla-war, viet-nam, vietnam, vietnam-war

quote: The encouraging thing is that every time you meet a situation, though you may think at the time it is an impossibility and you go through the tortures of the damned, once you have met it and lived through it you find that forever after you are freer than you ever were before. If you can live through that, you can live through anything. You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: To those of you with your years of service still ahead, the challenge is yours. Stop doubting yourselves. Have the courage to make up your minds and hold your decisions. Refuse to be BOUGHT for a nickel, or a million dollars, or a job!
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: My generation of radicals and breakers-down never found anything to take the place of the old virtues of work and courage and the old graces of courtesy and politeness.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
category: courage, courtesy, fscottfitzgerald, hardwork, inspirational, politeness, scottfitzgerald, values, virtues

quote: Sometimes there are no words to help one's courage. Sometimes you just have to jump.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés, Women Who Run With the Wolves: Myths and Stories of the Wild Woman Archetype

quote: If you can't appreciate the full worth of my courage, you can't admire my mastery.
author: Efrat Cybulkiewicz
category: appreciate-yourself, appreciation-quotes, approval-of-others, courage, courage-to-be-oneself, self-acceptance, self-awareness, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-improvement, self-love, spiritual-development, spiritual-growth

quote: When you lack the courage to publicly defend biblical truth, it is a clear testimony that you lack the Holy Spirit. The gift of the Holy Spirit is a gift of no fear.
author: Felix Wantang, God's Blueprint of the Holy Bible: Volume 1
category: bible, courage, defend, gift, holy-spirit, jesus-christ, testimony

quote: ...if we somehow find the courage to go directly into the discomfort - even the discomfort of illness, pain, old age, and death - we might discover something unexpected there.
author: Roland Merullo, The Delight of Being Ordinary

quote: A certain kind of courage is required to follow what truly calls to us
author: why else would so many choose to live within false certainties and pretensions of security? If genuine treasures were easy to find this world would be a different place. If the path of dreams were easy to walk or predictable to follow many more would go that route. The truth is that most prefer the safer paths in life even if they know that their souls are called another way.
category: Michael Meade, Fate and Destiny, The Two Agreements of the Soul

quote: It takes a Bigger Courage to take on Danger, where None can be Sighted.
author: Vineet Raj Kapoor
category: courage, danger, ethics, life, morality, temptation, trust

quote: He hated dishonesty-- or lack of courage-- more than anything.
author: Elizabeth Strout, Anything Is Possible

quote: Educate every child for a good courage.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Father knew he might die that day, and he went anyway.
author: Catherine Jones Payne, Breakwater

quote: When shame becomes a management style, engagement dies. When failure is not an option we can forget about learning, creativity, and innovation .
author: Brené Brown, Daring Greatly: How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead

quote: There is a very thin line of demarcation between bravery and foolhardiness.
author: Anurag Shourie, Half A Shadow
category: brave-quotes, bravery, courage, demarcation, fool, foolhardiness, foolishness, fools, line

quote: It requires more courage to back down compared to moving forward.
author: Yeo Wen Qin

quote: We know your secret.And we won’t be made invisible.
author: Caroline George, The Vestige
category: caroline-george, courage, invisible, lies, secret, secrets, the-vestige, truth

quote: I'm not... I'm not without a heart,' he heard Sophia say, her chin raised, eyes straight ahead. 'I'm not. I just don't have the luxury of being soft. I am trying to survive.
author: Alexandra Bracken, Wayfarer
category: courage, love, soft, strong, strong-will, strong-woman, strong-women, survival, survive, survivor, survivors

quote: Start working on your child’s mind. Start building your child’s character. Raise your child as a human being, instead of raising boys and girls. Raise human beings with the religion of love in their hearts. Raise human beings with the language of compassion on their lips. Raise human beings with the color of joy on their face. Raise human beings with the force of bravery in their nerves. And these brave conscientious souls with the flames of compassion in their hearts shall one day change the course of human history.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality
category: brainy-quotes, braveheart, bravery, character, character-building, children, children-quotes, courage, future-generations, kids, life, lionheart, parent, parenthood, parenting, parenting-101, parenting-advice, parenting-children, parenting-quotes, parents-and-children, philosophy, raising-a-child, raising-children, raising-kids, social-progress, society, truth, words-of-wisdom

quote: The way I see it, if everybody ran from bad things instead of trying to stop them, bad things would be all there is.
author: Homer Hickam, Carrying Albert Home: The Somewhat True Story of A Man, His Wife, and Her Alligator

quote: In order to free ourselves from our assumptions about love, we must ask ourselves what long-held, often buried assumptions are and then face them, which takes courage, humility, and kindness.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection
category: courage, humility, kindness, love, mindfulness, real-love, real-love-quotes

quote: Be obdurately determined to bring your courage to the world.
author: Sravani Saha Nakhro

quote: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.
author: Brené Brown

quote: You have intellect, and courage, and command. Play your own game, and don't worry about what anyone else is doing. That is what's going to give you a shot at making it. Comparing yourself to anyone else will just drive you crazy.
author: Ellen Emerson White, A Season of Daring Greatly

quote: False reasons trapped in your old bean. Failure isn't your nemesis, denial of truth is.
author: Ymatruz
category: cope, coping, courage, denial, denial-of-feelings, failure, failure-quotes, fearless, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, survival, survival-instinct, survive

quote: The most painful moment in my life also became the moment I showed the most strength and courage.
author: Cecelia Ahern
category: courage, mental, overcome, painful, strength, strength-and-courage, strength-through-adversity

quote: It takes a special courage to challenge the rigid confines of our accustomed story. It’s not easy to radically alter our views about where happiness comes from but it’s eminently possible.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection

quote: Taking in another’s criticism, even when it’s offered out of love, requires courage.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection

quote: If you keep standing on the verge of greatness, you'll eventually get the courage to leap into it.
author: Curtis Tyrone Jones, Giants At Play: Finding Wisdom, Courage, And Acceptance To Encounter Your Destiny
category: courage, greatness, inspirational, leap, leap-of-faith, patience

quote: If you keep standing on the verge of greatness, you'll eventually get the courage to leap into it,
author: Curtis Tyrone Jones, Giants At Play: Finding Wisdom, Courage, And Acceptance To Encounter Your Destiny

quote: A person who finds grace never lacks the courage to endure, remain resolute in principles and action in the face of an easy collapse into anger, insanity, and self-destruction when living in an increasing chaotic world filled with armed conflict, terrorism, and cultural discord.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: anger, anger-management, chaos, chaotic, conflict, courage, courage-in-life, courage-quotes, courageous, discord, endure, enduring, grace, philosophy-of-life, principles, resolute, resolve, self-destruction, self-destructive-behavior

quote: We want deeper sincerity of motive, a greater courage in speech and earnestness in action.
author: Sarojini Naidu

quote: It is necessary to grow up in maturity, firmness and courage in order to reach the goal
author: Sunday Adelaja
category: courage, firmness, goal, grow, growth, maturity

quote: In order to defeat the darkness, you must bring it into the light.
author: Seth Adam Smith, Rip Van Winkle and the Pumpkin Lantern
category: courage, darkness, defeat-the-darkness, light, light-and-darkness, overcome

quote: You cannot defeat darkness by running from it.
author: Seth Adam Smith, Rip Van Winkle and the Pumpkin Lantern
category: courage, darkness, darkness-within, light, light-within, running

quote: The real heroes are those who rebuild their lives using adversity as a stepping stone to greatness in the midst of the chaos life has thrown at them.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: adversity, courage, crps, focus, inner-strength, master-mind, master-the-mind, rebuilding, stepping-stones, strength, wild-women

quote: An act of redemption, the ultimate act of personal grace, is an undervalued form of courage.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls

quote: Do not chase another human being. Instead, chase your curiosity. Chase your development and your goals. Chase your passion. Strive to work for something bigger than yourself, and instead of trying to convince someone that you fit within their world, strive to build your own.
author: Bianca Sparacino, Seeds Planted in Concrete

quote: Her wounds brought her a great source of power because they lived in the same place as her heart.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: blindsighted, courage, fortitude, grief, lessons-learned, love, resilience, strength, survivor, survivor-of-abuse, true-love, victim, wounded

quote: Courage is an act of grace when it is not required; it originates from an inner necessity to honor, love, and cherish people, and respect oneself.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: brave, brave-quotes, bravery, courage, courage-in-life, courage-quotes, courageous, grace, honorable, honorable-men, honorable-person, honoring-yourself, love, self-respect

quote: It is easy to die,' replied the bannik. 'Harder to live.
author: Katherine Arden

quote: A person must never live a lie. We free ourselves to live a full life by discovering the courage to face our illusions and live a true life.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: courage, courage-quotes, illusion, persoanl-accountability, personal-development, personal-growth, personal-responsibility, personal-responsibility-quotes, philosophy-of-life, true-life, truthful, truthfulness

quote: Some believe it is only great power that can hold evil in check, but that is not what I have found. It is the small everyday deeds of ordinary folk that keep the darkness at bay. Small acts of kindness and love. Why Bilbo Baggins? Perhaps because I am afraid, and he gives me courage.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Hobbit

quote: We derive courage from love. Bravery borne from love trumps the ingrained desire for self-preservation.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: brave, brave-quotes, bravery, courage, courage-in-life, courage-quote, courage-quotes, courageous

quote: I can't live a lie. I can't run from my life.
author: Melita Tessy, Battle of the Spheres: Crust, Mantle and Core
category: boldness, bravery, choice, courage, lies, life, live

quote: Grace represents the sublime glamour of human souls, the ability of physically courageous and emotionally brave people to give part of them in order to protect other people regardless of adverse consequence that they might personally endure.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: brave, brave-quotes, bravery, courage, courage-in-life, courage-quotes, courageous, grace, honorable, honorable-choices, honorable-men, honorable-person, protect, protection, protectiveness, self-sacrifice

quote: Human nature defeats me sometimes, how greed and spite can lurk so divisively around the utmost courage and sacrifice.
author: Jennifer    Ryan, The Chilbury Ladies' Choir
category: courage, england, greed, human-nature, sacrifice, spite, uk, wisdom, ww2

quote: And then I realized you were not rebellious but courageous. You know what that means? It means being scared but doing it anyway.
author: Marilyn Hilton, Full Cicada Moon

quote: It's okay to feel bad about how things went down, but it's not okay to drown in guilt and regret every day for having made decisions other people don't agree with. At some point, we all have to man up and decide to do what we have to do, despite the people around us who try to get in the way.
author: M-E Girard, Girl Mans Up

quote: WHAT I'M TELLING YOU IS, IF YOU WANT TO DO THINGS YOUR OWN WAY, YOU'RE GOING TO HAVE TO MAKE A DECISION - YOU'RE GOING TO HAVE TO FIND A LITTLE COURAGE.
author: John Irving, A Prayer for Owen Meany

quote: It takes courage and resilience to be true to ourself. We have to know that we will be okay even if others reject or ridicule us. We have to know it won’t destroy us.
author: Jeanine Joy, Ph.D.

quote: It's not just the body that must survive a jail term: the spirit and the will and the heart have to make it through as well. If any one of them is broken or destroyed, the man whose living body walks through the gate, at the end of his sentence, can't be said to have survived it.
author: Gregory David Roberts, Shantaram
category: courage, resilience, spirit, suffering, survival, willpower

quote: My mom's like me and she doesn't want to look weak in front of other people. And she's like Colby in the way that she has to take hits at other people whenever she feels threatened. That used to make me want to cave and do what she wants. But it doesn't anymore.
author: M-E Girard, Girl Mans Up

quote: If the voice was meant to be silent we wouldn't have ears for listening.
author: Veronica Purcell

quote: Every time we witness an injustice and do not act, we train our character to be passive in its presence and thereby eventually lose all ability to defend ourselves and those we love.
author: Julian Assange
category: challenges, character, courage, inspirational, justice, love

quote: It’s a small painful sort of courage which is at the root of every life, because injustice and cruelty is at the root of life. And the reason why I have only given my attention to the heroic or the beautiful or the intelligent is because I won’t accept that injustice and the cruelty, and so won’t accept the small endurance that is bigger than anything.
author: Doris Lessing, The Golden Notebook

quote: they told her, “fear the reaper."she laughed to herself and muttered, 'baby, death ain’t nothing’ more than a quick fuck. a little bit of silence after he comes.
author: Taylor Rhodes, moira: a ghost story
category: courage, death, love, moira, poetry, prose, sex

quote: You must accept your cross
author: if you bear it courageously it will carry you to heaven.

quote: If you have the understanding to first notice the signs, continue with the courage to follow them.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: awaken, awakening, awareness, be-brave, brave-heart, courage, destiny, fate, intuition, magic, mystical, synchronicity, understanding, understanding-life, wild-and-free

quote: It takes a tremendous amount of strength to be a single mother. To hold down the forte of a home, a life and your child's entire happiness.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: courage, life, motherhood, parenthood, single-mum, single-mum-quotes, single-parent, strength

quote: One day we will all stand alone and answer to God for the choices we have made in our lives. It will not be enough to say we did not get help because no one would come with us. Life is not easy, but we make it much more difficult when we refuse to be honest about what we feel. For the short term, not being honest may seem easier, but in the long haul, we pay a heavy price.
author: Sheila Walsh, Loved Back to Life: How I Found the Courage to Live Free

quote: ...he possessed for attractive form of courage: bravery of a nervous man. After all, any rash fool can be a hero if he sets no value on his life or hasn't the wit to appreciate the danger. But to understand the risks, perhaps even to flinch at first, but then summon the strength to face them down--that is my opinion is the most commendable for of value...
author: Robert Harris, Conspirata

quote: May you find courage in every circumstance.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The distance between you and your destination can be set to zero only by your courage to act and by your determination to sustain this action till the end!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: act, action, aim, aim-quotes, courage, courage-quotes, courageous, determination, distance, ildan-wisdom, ildan-wise-sayings, ildan-words, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotations, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotes, objective, relations, set-to-zero, sustain, target, target-quotations, target-quotes, turkish-authors, turkish-literature, turkish-playwrights, turkish-quotations, turkish-quotes, turkish-wisdom-words, turkish-writers, zero

quote: Letty's first false step was here: she said to herself _I can not_, and did not. She lacked courage--a want in her case not much to be wondered at, but much to be deplored, for courage of the true sort is just as needful to the character of a woman as of a man.
author: George MacDonald, Mary Marston

quote: Will you have the courage to obey the voice of God?
author: Craig Groeschel, Weird: Because Normal Isn't Working
category: courage, god, have, obey, of, the, to, voice, will, you

quote: Sometimes having courage means the hardest tasks fall onto your shoulders, and those leave the biggest scars.
author: C.J. Redwine, The Wish Granter

quote: Sometimes you have to walk through the fire, in order to reach your calling.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: author, books, calling, callings, courage, god-s-plan, life-purpose, novels, strength, tests, trials, writing

quote: Sometimes, breaking down is the bravest thing you can do.
author: Vironika Tugaleva
category: brave, breakdown, breaking-down, courage, crying, emotions, feeling, strength, vulnerability

quote: To experience courage, is to experience life. Reflected in loved ones, the greatest encouragement. Dignity, integrity and strength, a harmonious chord, interwoven into an unbreakable cord.
author: Tom Althouse
category: courage, harmony-quotes, humanity-and-society, inspirational-quotes-about-life, integrity, power-of-law-of-attraction, unity-quotes

quote: ...opportunities typically come disguised as impossible problems. And while most people run away from their problems, Shamgars run at them with their oxgoads.
author: Mark Batterson, All In: You Are One Decision Away From a Totally Different Life

quote: Courage doesn't wait until situational factors turn in one's favor. It doesn't wait until a plan is perfectly formed. It doesn't wait until the tide of popular opinion is turned. Courage only waits for one thing: a green light from God. And when God gives the go, it's full steam ahead, no questions asked.
author: Mark Batterson, All In: You Are One Decision Away From a Totally Different Life

quote: When God stirs our spirit or breaks our heart, we cannot sit back. We've got to step up and step in. We've got to go all in by going all out. But if we have the courage to make the choice or take the risk, it will become the defining moment of our lives.
author: Mark Batterson, All In: You Are One Decision Away From a Totally Different Life

quote: Courage is a certainty.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Who would ever know the greater graces of comfort and perseverance, mercy and forgiveness, patience and courage, if no shadows fell over a life?
author: Ann Voskamp, One Thousand Gifts: A Dare to Live Fully Right Where You Are
category: comfort, courage, forgiveness, grace, life, mercy, patience, perseverance, shadows

quote: Always count the costs before starting any journey, and never take a step without finding its costs.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: accountability, caution, confidence, courage, life, responsibility, risks

quote: There is nothing that can defeat you if it does not first capture your mind.
author: Kierra C.T. Banks
category: beautiful, beautiful-anomaly, courage, culture, defeat, endurance, fire, inspirational, journey, life, love, passion, qoutes, quotes-about-life, quotes-for-instagram, quotes-for-tumblr, quotes-to-live-by, strength

quote: Until there are so many of them that no one dares to chase them anymore. Until they're an army in themselves. Because if a sufficient number of people are different, no one has to be normal.
author: Fredrik Backman, My Grandmother Asked Me to Tell You She's Sorry

quote: Treat others good and you will be a moral compass.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: courage, gratitude, greatness, happiness, love, respect

quote: How does one measure bravery? I suppose one starts by looking at the difference between what you are naturally inclined to do, and what your sense of duty tells you you should do. Courage is what it costs you to cover the deficiency.
author: Ian Gardiner, In the Service of the Sultan: A First Hand Account of the Dhofar Insurgency

quote: Vulnerability of all the emotions is the one that is most often mistaken for weakness. In reality however the opposite is true
author: vulnerability is courage in its greatest form.

quote: Love and gratitude offers courage.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: An opinion isn't right or wrong. It's your interpretation of a subject or a situation. You can't be f......g wrong!"So, if I look at the sky and have the opinion that the clouds are pink, I'm right?""Yes! Because it's an opinion, not a fact, and maybe to you, the clouds are pink because you're nuts. An opinion doesn't need to be true for anyone else in the world but you. Stop trying to f.....g please everyone and just say what you think.
author: Leisa Rayven, Bad Romeo

quote: His words held depth, but not enough to make her forget the desire to do something more than just leave the hospital alive. All she could think of now was the pain of running away. She'd left her family, left Prague behind out of fear. And still war had chased her to an ARP shelter in the heart of London. How could she run again? Something mattered in standing up to fight.
author: Kristy Cambron, A Sparrow in Terezin

quote: If someone's trying to get you angry, the calmer you get, the angrier they'll get.
author: Valerie Jarrett

quote: If you are only worried about not making a mistake then you will communicate nothing
author: yo yo ma

quote: Inwardly, though, she was blown empty by a giant breath, and while they stood waiting for Mr. Henshaw to tie up the Clara she knew that she would never be the same poor, ignorant woman of an hour ago. She would be poor, all right, and she would be ignorant and she would be a woman, but never in the same ways.
author: M.F.K. Fisher, Sister Age

quote: Then don't you dare tell me my dreams are insane! Because my dreams are what I live for!
author: Robert Thier, Storm and Silence

quote: No.” The smile had left Sarah’s voice. “He still works for the Basij. Beware of weak men, little sister. He never returned to help, not even to express condolences for Father. Find a strong man. Get a man who will stand up for you, even if it means he has to fight the whole world. There is nothing more dangerous than a weak man.
author: Michael Benzehabe
category: bad-love, benzehabe, broken-engagement, courage, fiance, men, unassimilated, wasted-love, weak-men

quote: Bad governments always lie because telling the truth requires honour and courage!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: bad-government, courage, government-quotations, government-quotes, governments, honour, ildan-wisdom, ildan-wise-sayings, ildan-words, lie, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotations, mehmet-murat-ildan-quotes, turkish-authors, turkish-literature, turkish-playwrights, turkish-quotations, turkish-quotes, turkish-wisdom-words, turkish-writers

quote: Courageous people run toward the problem rather than away from it.
author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

quote: In the little chaos of Pearl's character there might be seen emerging-and could have been from the very first-the steadfast principles of an unflinching courage-an uncontrollable will-a sturdy pride which might be disciplined into self-respect-and a bitter scorn of many things, which, when examined, might be found to have the taint of falsehood in them.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne, The Scarlet Letter

quote: In a world without fear of death... people will never attain the hope that is to be found from casting their fears aside and persevering through them. While it is true that people can continue to press forward through the simple act of living... That is in no way comparable to marching forward in the face of death while doing their damnedest to keep it at bay. That is why... that is why people have given that very march a unique and special name. Courage.
author: Tite Kubo, Bleach―ブリーチ― 74 [Burīchi 74]

quote: Death is just a door that only love can come and go through.
author: T.L. Moffitt

quote: Luck is for those with nothing else. I wish you strength and courage.
author: Annette Marie, Unleash the Storm

quote: Maybe Father Auguste is right," Henry started thoughtfully, rising from a bench. "Maybe we should wait."From the back of the tavern, Peter stifled a burst of laughter. Henry gripped the edge of the table.Adrian turned to Henry with a withering glare."Maybe, my son," Adrian said quietly, "you should find your courage."Henry took a labored breath."You want to hunt the Wolf?" He narrowed his eyes, spurned. "All right, then. Let's hunt it.
author: Sarah Blakley-Cartwright, Red Riding Hood
category: adrian-lazar, courage, father-auguste, henry-lazar, hunt, peter, son, wait, wolf

quote: It is our courage which defines us, not our constraints
author: Gyan Nagpal
category: confidence, constraint, constraints, courage, define, define-your-life, perseverance

quote: One gains courage from the one in front of her and moves forward a few steps, passing her by just a little. Now the one farthest back gains courage from the one in front and moves forward until she, in turn, is the leader. And so in this way, taking courage from one another, they advance, as a group, towards the strange thing in front of them.
author: Lydia Davis, Can't and Won't: Stories

quote: [L]ife is more than just steering a course around pain.
author: Stephen King, Desperation
category: courage, determinism, life, philosophy, religion, stephen-king

quote: Courage is winning small battles with great honor.
author: Nathan S. Colestock

quote: It only takes patience to live through this life.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: There will be times in your life when you will have to stand alone in your pain and choke back all the injustice done to you. Letting go will be the hardest thing you have ever had to do because it means losing something you wish you didn't have to lose--the person that you care for. However, to be authentic--one person, it requires standing for truth as you know it to be, instead of having your dignity destroyed by another. It is a fire you have to walk through, in order to truly live. Sometimes, practicing faith by letting go is the most painful chapter of your life that will take every bit of courage for you to close, before you can be reborn.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: bravery, courage, dignity, honesty, integrity, letting-go, living, moving-forward, moving-on, speaking-the-truth

quote: Theres a remarkable amount of strength residing in those who move forward without being able to physically move. Ones that carry the weight of illness or a disability, they battle wars most know nothing about. They are the true warriors of the world, the ones who have every reason to quit but never do.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: brave, bravery, courage, disability, free-spirit, hope-in-healing, illness, illness-quotes, inner-strength, inspiration, inspiration-through-illness, inspirational, inspiring, philosophy, positive, quotes-for-illness, quotes-for-strength, strength, warrior, warrior-spirit, wisdom, wise-words

quote: When life places stones in your path, be the water. A persistent drop of water will wear away even the hardest stone.
author: Autumn Morning Star

quote: You didn’t find strength when you couldn’t live without it. You found it when you had someone or something you loved so much that it forced you to stretch the edges of yourself further than you thought was possible.
author: Martina Boone, Illusion

quote: The message of love or beauty or hope needs to be said by a hundred thousand different voices, written by a hundred thousand different pens, at a hundred thousand different times in history, different places in the world, different sectors of society, in different genres and registers, simply to be heard by the billions of ears and hearts that lie waiting for a truth which fires their soul, answers their question, speaks to their heart.
author: Lucy H. Pearce, The Rainbow Way: Cultivating Creativity in the Midst of Motherhood
category: artist, courage, creative-process, creativity, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, inspiring-words, speaking-truth

quote: When we have the courage to claim space for ourselves. When we risk creativity. When we relish our sensuality. When we honor our lives and their experiences as valuable. When we create from a female body, expressing ourselves in a woman’s voice, using a woman’s language. We begin to bloom.
author: Lucy H. Pearce, The Rainbow Way: Cultivating Creativity in the Midst of Motherhood
category: courage, creative-mothers, creative-process, creativity, creativity-quotes, motherhood, risk, womens-creativity

quote: There is no certainty, not even your next breath. Live like you are dieing because in reality we all are.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: adversity, courage, free-spirit, free-your-mind, inspiration, live, living-in-the-now, mindful, unquiet

quote: They were all becoming brothers, in the manner he had seen before: facing death together was the greatest of levelers.
author: Tad Williams, Shadowheart

quote: Once you set the bar high for yourself, you cannot go back to mediocrity. You must give world-class performance in all that you do. Your work ethic, persistence, effort and dedication will glow on your behalf. Do not brag about your accomplishments; allow your reputation to speak of your magnificence.
author: Luis Enrique Cavazos, The Five Virtues That Awaken Your Life
category: boldness, courage, existentialism, inspirational, performance, success

quote: Courage isn't knowing you can do something
author: it's only being willing to try . . .
category: Jennifer A. Nielsen, A Night Divided

quote: If you have no armsTo hold your crying child but your own armsAnd no legs but your own to run the stairs one more timeTo fetch what was forgottenI bow to youIf you have no vehicleTo tote your wee one but the wheels that you driveAnd no one else to worry, “Is my baby okay?”When you have to say goodbye on the doorsteps of daycareor on that cursed first day of schoolI bow to youIf you have no skill but your own skillTo replenish an ever-emptying bank accountAnd no answers but your own toSatisfy the endless whys, hows, and whens your child asks and asks againI bow to youIf you have no tongue to tell the truthTo keep your beloved on the path without a precipiceAnd no wisdom to impartExcept the wisdom that you’ve acquiredI bow to youIf the second chair is emptyAcross the desk from a scornful, judging authority waitingFor your child’s father to appearAnd you straighten your spine where you sitAnd manage to smile and say, “No one else is coming—I’m it.”Oh, I bow to youIf your head aches when the spotlight finally shineson your child because your hands are the only hands there to applaudI bow to youIf your heart aches because you’ve given until everything in you is goneAnd your kid declares, “It’s not enough.”And you feel the crack of your own soul as you whisper,“I know, baby. But it’s all mama’s got.”Oh, how I bow to youIf they are your life while you are their nurse, tutor, maidBread winner and bread baker,Coach, cheerleader and teammate…If you bleed when your child falls downI bow, I bow, I bowIf you’re both punisher and huggerAnd your own tears are drowned out by the running of the bathroom faucetbecause children can’t know that mamas hurt tooOh, mother of mothers, I bow to you.—Toni Sorenson
author: Toni Sorenson
category: courage, fathers, honor, life, motherhood, mothers, parenthood, parents, single-fathers, single-mothers

quote: Timing can be everything and wisdom requires the patience to wait as well as the courage to leap when the time becomes right.
author: Michael Meade, The Genius Myth

quote: Take the time to celebrate stillness and silence and see the joy that the world can bring, simply.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: It takes courage to dream, to face our futures and the limiting forces within us. It takes courage to be determined that, as we slow down physically, we are going to grow even more psychologically and spiritually. Courage, the philosopher Aristotle taught us, is the most important of all the virtues, because without it we can’t practice any of the others. Courage is the nearest star that can guide our growth. Maya Angelou said we must be courageous about facing and exploring our personal histories. We must find the courage to care and to create internally, as well as externally, and as she said, we need the courage “to create ourselves daily as Christians, as Jews, as Muslims, as thinking, caring, laughing, loving human beings.
author: Bud Harris
category: aging, aging-gracefully, aging-quotes, aging-well, authentic-life, authentic-living, authentic-self, authenticity, courage, courage-to-be-oneself, creativity, creativity-and-attitude, creativity-and-motivational, self-expression, senior-citizens, seniors, virtue

quote: There was no use feeling guilty about getting on to the ship when you are in the middle of the ocean. If you felt guilty or sorry, you had only one option – drown in the middle of the sea.
author: Jagdish Joghee

quote: When you find yourself internally, you find what nourishes you from within. You lose that entitlement and anger when YOU deliver.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck
category: anger, brave, courage, find-yourself, strong, wise

quote: I needed to realise my role in the drama and it was only then that I could learn and be better for it, and it was only then that I could move forward. I needed to move forward and had to look at each day as a way of becoming a better me. And when I got better, the people around me reciprocated.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: Wanting to live, but accepting death to save others: that was courage.
author: Maggie Stiefvater, The Raven King

quote: We all marveled that we'd gotten to take part in so perfect and courageous and amazing a life.
author: Wayne Earl, This Star Won't Go Out: The Life and Words of Esther Grace Earl

quote: We need more people in this world, energised by chasing a quest or a goal and that is what will energise the world.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: The word 'heresy' not only means no longer being wrong; it practically means being clear-headed and courageous. The word 'orthodoxy' not only no longer means being right; it practically means being wrong. All this can mean one thing, and one thing only. It means that people care less for whether they are philosophically right. For obviously a man ought to confess himself crazy before he confesses himself heretical.
author: G.K. Chesterton, Heretics
category: courage, crazy, heresy, orthodoxy, postmodernism, right, wrong

quote: Until a person has failed significantly or missed the boat, they will not know how to hold the tension until the right moment or how to test the waters before pushing on.
author: Michael Meade, Why the World Doesn't End: Tales of Renewal in Times of Loss

quote: If I always stuck up for what I had, I would have missed the most amazing things I have today. What are you fighting for that you need to let go? Release the magic within. The magic of what could be.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: Sometimes it’s the dirt between your toes that gives you the clearest picture in your mind. Grounding yourself aligns the dirt between your toes and the vision in your mind.
author: Tony Curl, Seriously Simple Stuff to Get You Unstuck

quote: When you are the central character in a seemingly boiling pit of “busy-ness” the time will come when the pace of decline cannot be countered. You build yourself the circumstances of ultimate failure by failing to grow, by failing to act on your learnings.
author: Tony Curl
category: courage, decline, failure, failure-to-learn, growth, importance, learning, priorities, time-management, urgency

quote: What a hideous life he had chosen, how painful was the loneliness he endured because he didn't have the courage to trust someone again. To trust someone entirely because in love there is no other way.
author: Nina George, The Little Paris Bookshop

quote: Real courage is being kind again, after you've felt that your kindness was thrown in your face. To risk it once more, or even twice more takes a special strength.
author: Clare Bell, Ratha's Courage

quote: This, he knew, was courage, the truest, ultimate courage, because there was no one here to sympathize or praise him for it. What he felt was felt without the hope of commendation.
author: Richard Matheson, The Shrinking Man

quote: Virtue begins with understanding and is fulfilled by courage.
author: Demosthenes

quote: Your world will expand for every step you dare to take outside your comfort zone.
author: Maria Erving

quote: Young man, be of good courage. Care not for what the world says or thinks: you will not be with the world always. Can man save your soul? No. Will man be your judge in the great and dreadful day of account? No. Can man give you a good conscience in life, a good hope in death, a good answer in the morning of resurrection? No! no! no! Man can do nothing of the sort. Then "fear not the reproach of men, neither be afraid of their revilings: for the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool" (Isa. 51:7,8). Call to your mind the saying of good Colonel Gardiner: "I fear God, and therefore I have none else to fear." Go and be like him.
author: J.C. Ryle, Thoughts for Young Men
category: courage, courage-quotes, cowardice, fear-of-god, fear-of-men, heaven, hell, life, young-men

quote: Strength was not how fiercely one punched, but instead, how one would summon the courage to take a blow for someone else.
author: J.F.Johns

quote: Anybody who listens to their intuition risk at times making other people disappointed or even pissed off because you're not tending to what they want from you but instead to what feels right for you.
author: Maria Erving

quote: Everything is possible for him who possesses courage and activity,'' she said, with a look resembling one of those heroines of the age of chivalry, whose encouragement was wont to give champions double valour at the hour of need; ``and to the timid and hesitating, everything is impossible, because it seems so.
author: Walter Scott

quote: There is one thing you must always remember about yourself; always be yourself, with courage and humility, no matter what!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: be-yourself-quotes, boldness-and-attitude, courage, humility-quotes, mindset, passion, pride

quote: With God, a mountain before me is soon to be a memory behind me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: barriers, belief, challenges, courage, determination, faith, fortitude, goal, goals, god, memories, memory, miracles, mountain, obstacles, tenacity

quote: We can't always control our circumstances, who are parents are, where we live, or how much money we make, but in those rare moments when we can shape our fate, when we do have the power to make our own happiness, we can't be too scared to do it.
author: Renee Carlino, Swear on This Life

quote: Every person fails, nobody achieves everything that he or she set out to achieve. Nobody, regardless of how many personal triumphs they enjoy, no matter how rich or powerful they become, goes through life without encountering failure. You cannot fail unless a person valiantly tries to accomplish a task. The most audacious person readily attempts difficult projects, despite feeling uncertain if they can prevail. Successful people exhibit the character to respond positively to failure. Some failures prove instrumental in altering a person’s outlook, and their revised perspective leads to brilliant successes
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: accom, accomplishment, attitude, attitude-quotes, attitude-toward-life, character, character-development, courage, courage-in-life, courage-quotes, failure, failure-and-attitude, failure-and-success, learning, learning-from-adversity, learning-from-experiences, learning-from-mistakes, learning-process, personal-development, personal-development-insights, personal-performance, perspective, perspective-on-life, successful, sucessessful

quote: The world is a better place to live in because it contains human beings who will give up ease and security and stake their own lives in order to do what they themselves think worth doing.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: I don't fear the future. I fear letting it pass by me, without ever trying to make it mine.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: courage, faith, goals, living, my-life, plans

quote: One needs to be either more brave or more good, because if courage is lacking goodness can substitute, while cowardice is the deficiency of both.
author: Neel Burton
category: bravery, courage, cowardice, epigrams, ethics, philosophy, vice, virtue

quote: Because you made it here on a lot less" he says and he has no idea how on the mark he is.
author: Courtney Summers, Please Remain Calm

quote: Being meek does not make you weak. You’re not someone who sways with changing circumstances. You don’t allow yourself to be used. You’re not passive or spineless. Your faith is in the Almighty, so you know that you are mighty.
author: Toni Sorenson, Aligned By Christ
category: courage, faith, god, inspiration, love, meek, strength, success

quote: Thinking it was easy to take a chance on things if you had nothing to lose -- politics, ideas, almost anything in fact; from the bottom of the ladder you could safely risk a fall, but the higher that you climbed the more cautious you must be.
author: Flavin, Martin

quote: The courage to conquer is indomitable will.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Challenges stimulate courage.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Only a bet on the impossible makes sense. It is an act of faith and courage requiring an irrational leap over reason. A man wins simply by making such a bet.
author: William  Kennedy, Roscoe
category: courage, inspirational, motivational, risk, self-motivation, success, truth-of-life

quote: We all write stories in our minds, but only few have the courage to put them on paper.
author: Sabine Shah

quote: All revered spiritual leaders, political leaders, and diplomats, captains of industry, intellectuals, and winning generals exhibit genuine humility that empowers them to act with integrity and courage under the most distressing circumstances.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls

quote: When you realize you are no longer made of glass, you lose the desire to demonstrate that fragility in others.
author: Chris Matakas, The Tao of Jiu Jitsu

quote: To make sense of it - that's the challenge. To bear witness to the death, without being broken by the weight of it.
author: M. L. Stedman - The Light Between Oceans

quote: Faith is courage.
author: Lance Conrad, The Price of Loyalty

quote: Daniel in the den
author: a champion in the den

quote: If your focus is on your failures, limitations, & fears, you've one sure destination. You'll get drowned. If not now, at the end of the day!
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: And it's true what I read about joy. It's the kind of happiness that not only fills you up but spills over. Really, all you have to do is look for it, and then have the strength to let it in. And believe it or not, that's the hardest part.
author: Jolene Perry
category: courage, happiness, hard, joy, looking, strength

quote: Having the courage to speak one's mind is as important as knowing when the time is right to do so.
author: Nana Awere Damoah

quote: BRAVE are the courageous souls who dare step outside the predefined yellowbrick road.
author: Kami Guildner, Firedancer: Your Spiral Journey to a Life of Passion and Purpose

quote: Take away your eyes from your past failures, current limitations, and future fears. Be hopeful, believe in yourself, be bold, and move on...
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: We are loved if we love, another truth we always seem to forget. ...Loving requires so much courage and so little expectation.
author: Nina George, The Little Paris Bookshop

quote: All you need is confidence in yourself. There is no living thing that is not afraid when it faces danger. The true courage is in facing danger when you are afraid, and that kind of courage you have in plenty.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: Gómez had suggested I steal a fish to achieve more courage and purpose. I regarded this task as an anthropological experiment, though it crossed a border into something approaching magic, or perhaps magical thinking. When I googled how to gut a fish, there were over 9 million results.
author: Deborah Levy, Hot Milk

quote: We need to develop courage, and we need to develop it in small ways first..... You develop a little courage, so that if you decide, "I will not stay in rooms where women are belittled; I will not stay in company where races, no matter who they are, are belittled; I will not take it; I will not sit around and accept dehumanising other human beings: - if you decide to do that in small ways, and you continue to do it - finally you realize you've got so much courage. Imagine it - you've got so much courage that people want to be around you. They get a feeling that they will be protected in your company.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: What would you know of struggle, perfect son? When have you fought against the mutilation of your mind? When have you had to do anything other than tally compliance's and polish your armor? The people of your world named you "Great One". The people of mine called me slave. Which one of us landed on a paradise of civilization to be raised by a foster father, Roboute? Which one of us was given armies to lead after training in the halls of the Macraggian High Riders? Which one of us inherited a strong, cultured kingdom? And which one of us had to rise up against a kingdom with nothing but a horde of starving slaves? Which one of us was a child enslaved on a world of monsters, with his brain cut up by carving knives? Listen to your blue clad wretches yelling courage and honor, courage and honor, courage and honor! Do you even know the meaning of those words? Courage is fighting the kingdom which enslaves you, no matter that their armies outnumber yours by ten-thousand to one. You know nothing of courage! Honor is resisting a tyrant when all others suckle and grow fat on the hypocrisy he feeds them. You know nothing of honor!
author: Angron, Wahammer 40K

quote: Courage.Hope.Sacrifice.
author: Rick Riordan, The Throne of Fire

quote: Am better off with the bad news disclosed to me than the good news hidden from me
author: ABC

quote: Don’t let anyone tell you what you can and can’t do or achieve. Do what you want to do and be who you want to be. Just encourage and include each other, don’t ostracize the gender in front of you.
author: Emma Watson
category: courage, empowerment, gender-equality, include, inspirational, self

quote: We as human beings lower our vibration everytime we react with the emotional attachment of what is only suppose to be a lesson through life.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: awakening, awareness, conciousness, courage, energy, higher-conciousness, know-yourself, rise, vibrations

quote: Monsieur Foinet got up and made as if to go, but he changed his mind, and, stopping, put his hand on Philip's shoulder."But if you were going to ask me my advice, I should say: take your courage in both hands and try your luck at something else. It sounds very hard, but let me tell you this: I would give all I have in the world if someone had given me that advice when I was your age and I had taken it."Philip looked up at him with surprise. The master forced his lips into a smile, but his eyes remained grave and sad."It is cruel to discover one's mediocrity only when it's too late. It does not improve the temper."He gave a little laugh as he said the last words and quickly walked out of the room.
author: W. Somerset Maugham, Of Human Bondage

quote: I had been to Jeddah on my previous trip, so I knew it well enough. There was only one thing to recommend it: say, you wanted to commit suicide and couldn’t quite find the courage, two days in Jeddah would do the trick.
author: Terry Hayes, I Am Pilgrim

quote: Motherhood by definition means a journey into the depths of one’s possibility.
author: H.L. Balcomb, Cinderella In Focus: "Curiosity is the doorway to our personal possibility!" 2nd Edition coming Oct.  31, 2017
category: cinderellainfocus, courage, empowerment, hlbalcomb, hope, motherhood, possibility

quote: To grow is not to timidly sit on some safe shore at water’s edge and clumsily grab whatever happens to float by me. Rather, it is to deliberately step into waters both calm and turbulent in order to wrestle great things to shore.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bold, challenges, courage, daring, determination, determined, float, grab, growth, intentionality, life, risk, risky, sacrifice, shore, wrestle

quote: You can repeat lies of others without hesitationBecause, you don’t have to give justification But, saying truth you have to be fearless and courageousBecause, you have to defend your viewsYou can not say truth without hurting sentiments of many people
author: Sammy Toora
category: atheist, courage, fearless, free-thinkers, lies, people, religion, sentiments, truth, view

quote: Fear leads to no where but to ground zero.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: Only the best thoughts is good enough to carry you throughout today's journey.
author: Auliq-Ice
category: confidence, courage, goal-in-life, goal-setting, happiness, hope, life-goals, positive-thinking, success, wisdom

quote: Definiteness of decision always requires courage, sometimes very great courage. The fifty-six men who signed the Declaration of Independence staked their lives on the decision to affix their signatures to that document.
author: Napoleon Hill, Think and Grow Rich

quote: There were so many things we left unsaid. Depending on how you look at it, whether you think it was worth saying it out loud, or better kept inside.
author: Diyar Harraz, One Minute to Midnight

quote: Courage is endurance for one moment more
author: Chelle Bliss, Dirty Work

quote: To forgive is a decision, to forget takes effort, to heal is a process, to believe again takes courage.
author: Victoria Wen

quote: Many people today believe that cynicism requires courage. Actually, cynicism is the height of cowardice. It is innocence and open-heartedness that requires the true courage-however often we are hurt as a result of it.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Standing alone scares alot of people it means they have to be themselves and more often than not they haven't the slightest clue who they've been all this time & that's why people stay the same because it's a frightening choice to step away from the crowd.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: be-yourself, bravery, courage, courageous, guidance, humble, inspire, know-yourself, life-quotes, love-yourself, nikki-rowe, stand-your-ground, stay-true, truth, unique

quote: He turned to face the long, shadowy hall. There was no turning back now. Unless, of course, he decided to turn back.
author: Lauren Magaziner, Pilfer Academy: A School So Bad It's Criminal

quote: Vision is the code that decodes every mediocrity out of life.
author: Auliq Ice
category: chasing-dreams, courage, dreams-come-true, happiness, hope, life-plans, opportunities-in-life, opportunity, positive-attitude, positive-thinking, success, vision, visions-in-life

quote: Risk all. Let life be a play, a risk, a gamble. And when you can risk all you will attain to a sharpness in your being: your soul will be born. The Golden Flower can bloom in you only if you are courageous, daring. It blooms only in courage.
author: Osho, The Secret of Secrets

quote: Can you call yourself a coward simply because the courage of others seems to you out of proportion to the triviality of the occasion? Thus wisdom creates cowards. And thus you miss Opportunity while spending your life on the lookout for it.
author: Umberto Eco, Foucault's Pendulum

quote: He which hath no stomach to this fight, let him depart, his passport shall be made and crowns for convoy put into his purse. We would not die in that man's company that fears his fellowship, to die with us.
author: William Shakespeare, Henry V

quote: The power of the night, the press of the storm, the post of the foe; where he stands, the Arch Fear in a visible form, yet, the strong man must go.
author: Robert Browning, Poetical Works

quote: When Abbess Ebba received tidings of the near approach of the pagan hordes, who had already wrecked vengeance upon ecclesiastics, monks, and consecrated virgins, she summoned her nuns to Chapter, and in a moving discourse exhorted them to preserve at any cost the treasure of their chastity. Then seizing a razor, and calling upon her daughters to follow her heroic example, she mutilated her face in order to inspire the barbarian invaders with horror at the sight. The nuns without exception courageously followed the example of their abbess. When the Danes broke into the cloister and saw the nuns with faces thus disfigured, they fled in panic. Their leaders, burning with rage, sent back some of their number to set fire to the monastery, and thus the heroic martyrs perished in the common ruin of their house.
author: Michael Barrett, A Calendar of Scottish Saints

quote: I find myself enjoying being alone a lot of the time, people come and people go and you have to find a way to be ok with both.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: acceptance, adversity, courage, crps, guidance, hope, illness, insight, inspirational-quotes, journey, mindfulness-practice, nikki-rowe, tragedy

quote: Courage brought me here.I desperately tried to dress myself with words.Yet excuses can no longer defend my walls.So here I am.Clueless.Defenseless.But I will tell you this,for this is all you have to know.I love you.Nothing in this life is more worthfighting for than that.
author: Frederick Espiritu, One Whole Naked Me

quote: If you can’t be brave in the face of adversity, at least be practical.
author: Clifford Cohen
category: adversity, bravery, clear-thinking, courage, dealing-with-adversity, grace-under-pressure, practicality

quote: There is a gift in experiencing so much tragedy of life from a young age, you gain the wisdom earlier to make better choices for later.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: adversity, becoming, brave-heart, courage, growth, hope, inner-being, lifes-twists-and-turns, over-coming, sacrifice, success, tragedy, truth

quote: I miss him for all the things he forgot to see in himself & if im lucky fate will help us rekindle a flame that never got set alight in the first place.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: courage, destiny, fate, finding-my-way, guidance, lost-love, love, love-quotes, missing-him, missing-someone, soul-connection, soul-mates, the-one-that-got-away, twin-flame

quote: If you want to make a difference, the next time you see someone being cruel to another human being, take it personally. Take it personally because it is personal.
author: Mavis Leno

quote: Love is anything but safe, it's wild and raw and will rip at your heart strings but once you've tasted it for the very first time it becomes like an addiction feeling nostalgia when seperated for another beating heart & before them you question where you called home.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: courage, love, love-quotes, soul-mate, true-love, twin-flame, twin-soul

quote: My ability is greater than my disability.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: acceptance, changes, courage, crps, disability, disability-quotes, growth, hope, illnes-to-wellness, inspiration, life, mindset, rehabiliskate

quote: Men with Honor are not killed by swords, they die of Shame.
author: Alok Jagawat

quote: People should be courage to read books, it should be made in such way how I changed my opinion how James Patterson did it. It should be done a way in which people should se the advantages of reading a book.
author: Deyth Banger
category: book, books, courage, read, should, to

quote: Either life entails courage or it ceases to be life.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: True heroism is not reserved solely for men and women in uniform. Heroes come in all genders, shapes, sizes and colors. We thank these world heroes for their sacrifices, courage and acts of valor that have made a difference in the world.
author: James Morris Robinson, Genesis: A New World Order

quote: But it was women like Rudabeh who planted in my mind the idea of a different kind of woman whose courage is private and personal. Without making any grand claims, without aiming to save humanity or defeat the forces of Satan, these women were engaged in a quiet rebellion, courageous not because it would get them accolades, but because they could not be otherwise. If they were limited and vulnerable, it was an audacious vulnerability, transcending the misogyny of their creator and his times.
author: Azar Nafisi, Things I've Been Silent About: Memories

quote: I could have loved him with everything I had but he wasn't prepared for the depth i provided ~ had I been a woman of weakness I would have stayed, but he lost the chance when he said I wasn't enough that day.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: breakup, courage, empowered-women, guidance, hope, know-your-worth, let-go, lost, love-yourself-first, moving-forward, moving-on, quotes, self-love, self-worth, strong-woman, strong-women, truth, wise-women

quote: I have died at the ripe age of twenty.Smile, for the world didn't get a chance to disappoint me.I have died at the mature age of ninety.Smile, for my life was more than satisfying.I have died suddenly—out of the blue.Smile, for I didn't have to fall ill before you.I have died from a long illness.Smile, for I had the chance to say goodbye.I did not want to leave this Earth.But smile, for I am still here among you.Why are you crying?Can you not see I am smiling?
author: Kamand Kojouri
category: age, chance, courage, cry, crying, death, die, died, disappoint, dying, earth, faith, goodbye, grief, guidance, hope, ill, illness, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, losing, loss, mourn, mourning, ninety, sad, satisfy, satisfying, smile, smiling, suddenly, twenty, upset

quote: Start with a cry, end with a smile.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson, Master of Maxims
category: affliction, comfort, courage, expectations, fortitude, guts, happiness, hard-work, hardship, hope, joy, now, perseverance, smile, strength, tears

quote: You can't force someone to care... You can only come to the realization that if you stay, they'll keep hurting you. I wish you the wisdom and courage to walk away and begin the healing process.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: And you finally get there, you reach a point where you refuse to feel anymore pain and the desire to chase happiness out weighs any choice that gives you reason to question where you're headed.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: awakening, be-yourself, courage, follow-your-truth, guidance, journey, know-yourself, life, life-lessons, life-quotes, pathway, quotes, truth, understanding, wild-and-free

quote: Wisdom is finding the path that is best for all - considering the options, the positives and the negatives - and having the courage to change what must be changed for the sake of the entire world.
author: Laurence Overmire, The Ghost of Rabbie Burns: An American Poet's Journey Through Scotland
category: brotherhood-of-man, change-the-world, conscience, courage, truth, wisdom

quote: Even if you are having a nightmare day during which nothing will go right, never cease looking for the ball. In the end everything will come right, for football is a game that rewards those who show courage.
author: Duncan Edwards

quote: No matter what, I would never let the people who wanted me to break see how much damage they had inflicted.
author: Rachel L. Schade, Silent Kingdom
category: bold, brave, bravery, break, breaking, courage, courageous, damage, damaged, fantasy-series, fantasy-ya, overcome, overcoming-adversity, overcoming-obstacles, silent-kingdom, silent-kingdom-series, strength, strong, strong-female, strong-female-character, survival, survivor, ya, young-adult, young-adult-fantasy-series

quote: And I hope above all you give your heart to someone again no matter how many broken promises you have recieved.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: authentic, beginnings, breakup, courage, endings, growth, heartbreak, heartbreaks-hurts, heartbroken, hope, life-lessons, love, love-quotes, real, synchronicity, truth

quote: All those dotted lines were just the parts of the story where she would get on the ground and get her hands dirty with the mess of it all. The mess and the glory of other people’s hearts and heart songs. She would learn it would take grit, and guts, and courage to make a difference. But the world will always need people who care enough to make a difference, so she needed to not miss her casting call.
author: Hannah Brencher, If You Find This Letter: My Journey to Find Purpose Through Hundreds of Letters to Strangers
category: courage, dotted-lines, grit, hands, hearts, making-a-difference

quote: Mma Ramotswe reflected on how easy it was to find oneself committed to a course of action simply because one lacked the courage to say no.
author: Alexander McCall Smith, Tears of the Giraffe

quote: To respect the opinions of those who stand against you is nothing short of courageous.
author: Raif Badawi, 1000 Lashes: Because I Say What I Think
category: courage, freedom-of-speech, freespeech, liberty, opinion, pluralism

quote: Fear of facing the grasp of death changes one's outlook on every little thing.
author: Debbie Ruryk

quote: Running from horrors doesn't help. The only way to deal with them is to meet them head-on.
author: Peter David, Cold Wars

quote: If life didn't end,' he said, 'there would be no need for me. To choose love in the face if death is the ultimate act of courage. I am the joy, but you are the meaning. Together, we make humanity more that it otherwise might have been.
author: Martha Brockenbrough, The Game of Love and Death

quote: You go on with your life, because life goes on,” says Isabel. “You see this in anyone who has survived a traumatic situation. My own daughter died, for example.” Her only daughter, Paula Frias, died of porphyria in 1992 at the age of twenty-seven. “At first you think you can’t live with this,” says the author, who just turned sixty-five. “It’s just too much. Then life begins to take over. One morning you wake up and you want to eat chocolate. Or walk in the woods. Or open a bottle of wine. You get back up on your feet.” “When you can, right?” “You have no choice!” Isabel insists. “You cannot let the bullies keep you on the floor! I have been on my knees a thousand times, and I always get up.
author: Mark Matousek, When You're Falling, Dive: Lessons in the Art of Living

quote: The French have a term for this brazenness: je m’en foutisme, the brave art of not giving a damn.
author: Mark Matousek, When You're Falling, Dive: Lessons in the Art of Living

quote: Feel compassion for your own heart that was broken open by grief or confusion.Then tune in to the other level of that experience.
